result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramses Hernandez-Perez

records.addlTxt: Due to defendant's compliance with the terms of the agreement, court cancelled the midpoint review hearing. Court scheduled the final review hearing with parties. Final review hearing scheduled for January 23rd, 2023 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramses Hernandez-Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DPA documents, received and filed
Elements of the Offense/WIS JI - Criminal

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Plea Addendum, received and filed

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests DPA resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
appointing counsel, filed and signed.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn Interpreter: Reme Bashi
Case in court for status of counsel. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Ruby DeLeon  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 09/01/2022 and on the first of every month thereafter until paid in full.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment. Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholamew.
Case in court for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel on this case. SPD to be contacted regarding status. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramses Hernandez-Perez appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramses Hernandez-Perez appeared by video means.   Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa. 
Case in court for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel on this case at this time. Court adjounrs matter. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ramses Hernandez-Perez appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court will adjourn case.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ramses Hernandez-Perez in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 2:30p
